[[File:LJ7A3094-2.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Fashion Models pose for a photoshoot, 2015]]
The '''2010s''' have thus far been defined by a revival of [[1940s fashion|austerity era]] period pieces, [[Hipster (contemporary subculture)|hipster]] fashion, [[1980s in fashion|1980s]] neon colors, and from late 2012 to 2016, unisex [[1990s in fashion|early 1990s]] styles influenced by grunge<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.today.com/style/return-teen-spirit-grunge-back-fashion-thats-not-bad-thing-6C10984421|title=Return of 'Teen Spirit'? Grunge is back in fashion (and that's not a bad thing)|deadurl=no|accessdate=2014-07-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/metroplus/grunge-is-the-way-to-go/article6238366.ece|title=Grunge is the way to go|deadurl=no |accessdate=2014-07-28|location=Chennai, India|work=The Hindu|first=Madhulika|last=Gautama|date=2014-07-22}}</ref> and [[skater fashion]]s.<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/fashion/galleries/baseball-jackets.html 1980s style Baseball jacket]</ref>
In the early 2010s, many [[2000–2009 in fashion|mid and late 2000s fashions]] remained popular in Europe, the United States, Latin America, Australasia and East Asia, especially the [[indie pop]] look which largely drew upon elements of [[1970s in fashion|1970s]] [[garage rock]], the [[1960s fashion|1960s]] counterculture, and contemporary [[alternative fashion]]. Popular global fashion brands include [[Forever 21]], [[Topshop]], [[Topman]], [[Uniqlo]], [[Christian Dior]], [[Hollister Co.|Hollister]], [[Abercrombie and Fitch]], [[Ben Sherman]], [[Lacoste]], [[Penshoppe]], [[Bench (Philippine clothing brand)|Bench]], [[H&M]], [[Nine West]], Kashieca, Human, [[Burberry]] (especially in China from 2010–15),<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/money/markets/article-3274628/Burberry-s-bubble-bursts-Beijing-woes-hit-sales-1-295-trenchcoats-895-ponchos-sparking-shares-nosedive-bonus-cuts.html Burberry bubble bursts, 24 Oct 2015]</ref> Monsoon, [[River Island]], [[Dorothy Perkins]], Coach, [[Marks and Spencer]], [[Hugo Boss]], and Alberto.
The leading European designers of the early 2010s included [[Nicolas Ghesquière]], [[Miuccia Prada]], [[Frida Giannini]], [[Marc Jacobs]], [[Phoebe Philo]] and [[Karl Lagerfeld]]. Notable Asian fashion designers include [[Rajo Laurel]], [[Michael Cinco]], Francis Libiran, Albert Kurniawan, Monique Lhuillier, Paul Cabral, Josie Natori and Jojie Lloren. Top male international models include [[Sean O'Pry]], [[David Gandy]], and teenager [[Brooklyn Beckham]].<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-3286707/Brooklyn-Beckham-cuts-cool-figure-skinny-jeans-Chelsea-boots-flies-solo-short-stint-London.html Brooklyn wearing skinny jeans]</ref> Top female international models include [[Lara Stone]], [[Karlie Kloss]], [[Joan Smalls]], [[Natasha Poly]], [[Liu Wen]], [[Anja Rubik]], [[Freja Beha Erichsen]], [[Mariacarla Boscono]], [[Suki Waterhouse]],<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-3285894/Sneak-peek-Burberry-s-new-campaign-Duke-Duchess-Cambridge-s-favourite-photographer-Mario-Testino-shoots-live-Snapchat-industry-first.html Mario Testino shoots live snapchat]</ref> [[Mary Wu]], [[Saskia de Brauw]], [[Georgina Wilson]], [[Solenn Heussaff]], [[Ashley Hart]], [[Megan Young]], [[Gigi Hadid]] and [[Cara Delevingne]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://models.com/rankings/ui/Top50/ |title=MODELS.com's Top 50 Models |deadurl=no |accessdate=2013-08-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://models.com/rankings/ui/IndustryIcons |title=MODELS.com's Industry Icons |deadurl=no |accessdate=2013-08-28}}</ref>
==Women's clothing==
===Early 2010s (2010–12)=== [[File:2013 - Jing Ulrich in China.jpg|thumb|175px|Chinese woman wearing brightly colored 1980s inspired dress, 2013.]]
====1980s influences==== * The early 2010s saw many recycled fashions from the [[1950s fashion|1950s]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://uk.specials.lifestyle.yahoo.com/style-it-light/guest-column-detail/be-inspired-by-the-hour%E2%80%99s-fifties-fashion-3254 |title=Style it light |publisher=Uk.specials.lifestyle.yahoo.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> [[1970s in fashion|1970s]] and [[1980s in fashion|1980s]] as designers from stores like [[Topshop]] replicated original [[vintage clothing]]. In the United States, it was popular to wear [[Gucci]], [[Chanel]], or [[Versace]] designer clothing, and neon colors such as pink, green, teal, black, purple, magenta and yellow.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.neonfiller.com/wordpress/ |title=Neon filter: indie and alternative website |publisher=Neonfiller.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> * Popular tops for American, British and Australian women aged 20–50 included [[tunic]]s, 1980s style [[baseball jacket]]s,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thetenbest.co.uk/the-ten-best-baseball-jackets/ |title=Womens baseball jackets |publisher=Thetenbest.co.uk |date=2011-01-28 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> oversized [[cardigan (sweater)|cardigan]]s, [[western shirt]]s, 2fer and layered shirts and tees, dresses and shirts worn with belts, [[Perfecto motorcycle jacket]]s customized with [[Shirt stud|stud]]s,<ref>[http://www.schottnyc.com/about.cfm One for the History Books] Schott NYC</ref> floral [[camisole]]s worn with matching [[boyshorts]], and [[sundress]]es. European women wear sparkly dresses, baggy one-size-fits-all [[Empire line]] skirts, [[blouse]]s and dresses, and lace, figure-hugging white [[organza]] [[maxi dress]]es inspired by [[Pippa Middleton]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/royal-wedding/8484342/Royal-wedding-Pippa-Middleton-shines-as-maid-of-honour.html |title=Pippa Middleton shines as Maid of Honor |publisher=Telegraph.co.uk |date= 2011-04-29|accessdate=2012-01-21 |location=London |first=Anita |last=Singh}}</ref> * From 2010 to 2013 many late 2000s fashion trends remained popular in Europe, the United States, East Asia, and Latin America, especially [[acid wash]] [[skinny jeans]], "trouser-dresses", [[romper suit]]s,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.azcentral.com/style/fashion/articles/2009/04/29/20090429jumpsuit.html |publisher=AZ Central |title=Jumpsuits are one-piece wonders |deadurl=no |accessdate=2013-08-28}}</ref><ref name="Stuff.co.nz_624892">{{cite news |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/life-style/fashion/624892 |title=One-piece rompers seen as hot outfit for spring |date=12 September 2008 |agency=[[Reuters]] |work=[[Stuff.co.nz]] |accessdate=5 November 2011}}</ref> [[preppy]] pastel colored skinny jeans, and [[capri pants]] cropped at the ankle. Possibly due to the poor economy in the early years, the [[skirt|midi skirt and the maxi skirt]] were the most common skirt and dress styles, with the hemline standards being the longest they had been since [[The Great Depression]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marketoracle.co.uk/Article36125.html |title=What Skirt Lengths Tell You About The Stock Market |accessdate=January 8, 2015}}</ref>
====1990s influences==== * From late 2012 onward, 1990s inspired fashion began to make a comeback in the UK, USA, Philippines, India, and Australasia among women aged 18–30.<ref>[http://www.buzzfeed.com/jasonsmith/versace-the-next-big-thing-for-2013-3muj]</ref> Popular upper apparel includes [[ugly sweater]]s,<ref>[http://uk.lifestyle.yahoo.com/photos/best-christmas-novelty-jumpers-winter-knitwear-xmas-1351523220-slideshow/christmas-jumpers-photo-1728323418.html Xmas sweaters]</ref> [[khaki]] [[superdry]] [[trenchcoat]]s,<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2243853/Pippa-Middleton-gives-Superdry-royal-seal-approval-beige-mac-sells-overnight.html Pippa Middleton]</ref> T-shirts with [[blazer]]s, plaid,<ref name="#TBT90sRevival">{{cite web|url=http://elitedaily.com/life/tbt-five-90s-fashion-trends-that-are-totally-back-in-style/ |title=#TBT: Five 90s Fashion Trends That Are Totally Back In Style |accessdate=10 June 2014}}</ref> oversized [[flannel]] shirts worn or tied around the waist, oversized T-shirts, padded [[gilet]]s,<ref>[http://metro.co.uk/2014/11/17/11-ridiculously-cool-novelty-christmas-fashion-buys-that-arent-jumpers-4951090/ Christmas fashions]</ref> [[Penshoppe]] skater skirts (in the Philippines), [[skort]]s, and [[crew neck]] [[sweater]]s. Crop tops were also reintroduced,<ref name="#TBT90sRevival" /> but they didn't prove popular in stores.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/01/09/living/2013-fashion-trends-to-forget/ |title=These fashion trends from 2013 aren't coming back |accessdate=10 June 2014 | work=CNN}}</ref> In the UK and the US, popular bottom apparel includes skinny jeans, leggings, [[hammer pants|parachute pants]],<ref name="#TBT90sRevival" /> [[railroad stripe]] pants or skirts,<ref>[http://fashionista.com/2012/09/trendspotting-railroad-stripes Trendspotting railroad stripes]</ref> boyfriend jeans, and [[high rise (fashion)|high-waisted]] [[shorts]]. * Desirable footwear included rain boots, flat sandals, [[stiletto]]s, [[Keds]], [[TOMS Shoes]], [[Chucks]], [[Sperry top-siders boat shoes.|Sperry top-siders boat shoes]], [[flat knee high riding boots]], [[Uggs]], [[moccasin]]s, [[Hunter brand]] [[rain boots]], [[Ballet flat|Ballerina flats]], [[cavalier boots]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sofeminine.co.uk/mag/fashion/d2590/c67934.html |title=Sonia Rykiel cavalier boots |publisher=Sofeminine.co.uk |date=1912-07-05 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> [[gladiator]] [[sandal]]s, [[flip-flops]], [[combat boot]]s,<ref name="#TBT90sRevival" /> [[Doc Martens]], and [[The Timberland Company]] hiking boots.
===Mid 2010s (2013-16)===
====Monochromatic and printed clothing==== [[File:Mid 2010s Dresses.JPG|thumb|250px|right|The A-line dress made a comeback in 2014. Hemlines also became shorter than they were in the early 2010s.]] * By the mid 2010s neon colors were out of style in Europe, America and Australasia, and they were replaced by black, white, various shades of [[gray]],<ref>[http://www.theguardian.com/fashion/2014/apr/15/grey-colour-decade-fashion-designers Grey Decade]</ref> and [[charcoal (color)|charcoal]] first on the [[catwalk]], and later as street fashion.<ref name="5StyleTrends2014">{{cite web|url=http://www.stylemepretty.com/living/2014/01/17/5-trends-to-take-into-2014/ |title=5 Style Trends For 2014 |accessdate=10 June 2014}}</ref> Black and white (sometimes red)<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2178746/North-Korea-Kim-Jong-marries-singer-Ri-Sol-ju.html Kim Jong's wife]</ref> [[Polka dot]] blouses<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2888045/Melissa-McCarthy-displays-slimmer-figure-tight-fitting-leather-trousers-sheer-polka-dot-shirt-45-pound-weight-loss.html Melissa McCarthy]</ref> and dresses underwent a revival in China and North Korea<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/9939243/Polka-dot-dresses-on-trend-in-North-Korea.html Polka dot in North Korea]</ref> in addition to chunky 90s inspired [[platform heels]].<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2950718/North-Korean-fashion-changing-thanks-country-s-Spice-Girls.html Changing North Korean fashion]</ref><ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2896014/Havana-Brown-sexes-Socceroos-training-session-plunging-halter-neck-polka-dot-jumpsuit.html Havana Brown]</ref> This trend had spread to Middle Eastern countries like [[Turkey]], [[Iran]] and the [[United Arab Emirates]] by 2016,<ref>[http://www.thestar.com/business/2016/01/06/dolce-gabbana-debuts-line-of-high-end-hijabs-and-abayas.html Toronto Star]</ref> with Italian brand [[Dolce and Gabbana]] launching a range of black and white [[hijab]]s and [[abaya]]s decorated with lace daisies, roses and lemons.<ref>[http://qz.com/586683/dolce-gabbana-launched-a-line-of-beautiful-high-end-hijabs-and-abayas/ Quartz Dolce and Gabbana hijabs]</ref> * Monochromatic clothing trends of 2014 and early 2015 included black and white lace dresses,<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2798629/rooney-mara-shows-sides-pretty-florals-sheer-black-rome-film-festival.html Rooney Mara]</ref> lace [[blouse]]s,<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2787556/Eva-Longoria-joined-pal-Melanie-Griffith-charity-event-LA-match-stunning-black-ensembles.html Terry Crews]</ref> jackets and dresses with [[peter pan collar]]s, [[blazer]]s, black and white striped "[[Beetlejuice]]" style [[slim-fit pants]],<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/fashion/brands/what-to-buy-from-balmain-for-h-and-m-collection/ Balmain collection 2015]</ref> long black velvet blazers decorated with silver braid, [[tuxedo]] jackets (often having contrasting black velvet or satin lapels),<ref>[http://www.stylebistro.com/Photos+-+Things+That+Are+Coming+to+T.J.+Maxx+This+Spring/articles/UXEhcWRzh3Q/Black+and+White New trends at T.J. Maxx]</ref> [[crop top]]s,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2014/05/11/fashion/Bared-Midriff-fashion-red-carpet-crop-top.html?_r=0 |title=The Time of the Tummy |accessdate=January 8, 2015 | work=The New York Times |first=Shivani |last=Vora |date=2014-05-09}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://nypost.com/2014/04/11/celebs-try-their-hand-at-crop-top-trend/ |title=Celebs try their hand at crop top trend |accessdate=January 8, 2015 | work=New York Post |first=Anahita |last=Moussavian |date=2014-04-11}}</ref> oversized coats,<ref name="5StyleTrends2014" /> striped [[culottes]], loose [[Capri pants]],<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-3076646/Celebrities-wear-summer-s-unflattering-trends.html 2015 summer trends]</ref> patent leather [[gladiator sandals]], [[romper suit]]s, puffer jackets and vests,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vogue.com/3348809/puffer-coat-trend-fall/ |title=The Puffer Gets Pretty this Fall: 5 Stylish Down Coats to Try Now |accessdate=January 8, 2015}}</ref> knee-length skirts,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://petite.about.com/od/springsummer2014/ss/Michael-Kors-Spring-2014-Runway-Fashion_5.htm |title=Michael Kors Spring 2014 Runway Fashion |accessdate=January 8, 2015}}</ref> [[pencil skirt]]s,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://magazine.foxnews.com/style-beauty/10-ways-make-pencil-skirt-work-you |title=10 Ways to Make the Pencil Skirt Work for You |accessdate=January 8, 2015 | work=Fox News |date=2011-07-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fashiondivadesign.com/15-ways-to-wear-pencil-skirts/ |title=15 Ways To Wear Pencil Skirts |accessdate=January 8, 2015}}</ref> black and white geometric printed leggings, and cuffed [[boyfriend (fashion)|boyfriend jeans]].<ref name="5StyleTrends2014" /> Denim declined in popularity in the US,<ref>[https://uk.news.yahoo.com/montana-lawmaker-says-yoga-pants-illegal-013728701.html#kHHzawG proposed yoga pants ban in Montana]</ref> with black or grey [[yoga pants]] and leggings replacing them.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://nypost.com/2014/08/12/athleisure-trend-sends-denim-sales-plummeting/ |title='Athleisure' trend sends denim sales plummeting |accessdate=January 8, 2015 | work=New York Post |first1=Amber |last1=Sutherland |first2=Sophia |last2=Rosenbaum |date=2014-08-12}}</ref>
====Eastern fashions and carry-over styles==== *Continuing on from the late 2000s, [[Fashion in India]] moved away from [[clothing in India|traditional clothes]] like the [[saree]]<ref>[http://gulfnews.com/news/asia/india/wife-s-jeans-ban-is-grounds-for-divorce-india-court-rules-1.1353273 Wifes Jeans ban grounds for divorce]</ref> and glamorous [[Bollywood]] style dresses in favor of a [[Indo-Western fashion|more Westernized style]] that incorporated navy pants, [[blazer]]s, [[leather jacket]]s, [[waistcoat]]s and androgynous military jackets.<ref>[http://www.vogue.in/content/the-redefined-salwar-kurta-is-here/ Redefined salwar kurta is here]</ref> Popular casual footwear included leather [[dress boot]]s, [[stiletto]] heels, platform sandals, and open toe pumps.<ref>[http://www.vogue.in/content/the-redefined-salwar-kurta-is-here/ Redefined salwar kurta]</ref> Cream, grey, blue and orange [[Kurta]] dresses with side slits<ref>[http://www.vogue.in/content/modern-indian-20-new-kurtas-own/ Vogue Modern Indian]</ref> decorated with pink or purple embroidery and synthetic jewels were worn with jeans or leggings, [[T shirt]]s, [[tank top]]s and [[bat wing]] sleeve blouses were paired with traditional silk [[salwar]] [[pajama]]s<ref>[http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/bollywood-influence-on-fashion-trends/1/230516.html Bollywood trends waning]</ref> or short shorts, and the large hoop earrings declined in popularity in favor of smaller minimalist gold jewelery. In the US, some very daring<ref>[http://www.mirror.co.uk/3am/celebrity-news/kendall-jenner-goes-knickerless-daring-3702662 Kendall goes knickerless]</ref> women wore kurta dresses of this type [[freebuffing|completely bottomless]],<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3085525/Alexis-Craft-asked-leave-dance-Kendall-Jenner-style-dress-thigh-high-slits.html Alexis Craft]</ref> most notably reality TV star [[Kendall Jenner]] in 2013.<ref>[http://fashionbombdaily.com/2014/06/hot-hmm-kendall-jenners-much-music-awards-fausto-puglisi-fall-2013-white-embellished-thigh-slit-dress/ Kendall Jenner's dress 2013]</ref> * Many fashion trends from the early years of the decade, especially the 1960s inspired indie, neo-hippie and [[boho chic]] looks, remained relevant in the US and Europe as far as 2015. This included [[skinny jeans]], [[tunic]]s, floral print dresses, [[skirt|midi and maxi skirts]], [[motorcycle]] jackets, [[western shirt]]s, red and blue geometric print blouses, patterned and solid colored [[tights]], [[overalls]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/fashion/denim-overalls-making-comeback-chic-fashion-options-article-1.1719684#ixzz34DGI0IsJ |title=Denim overalls are making a comeback — as chic fashion options |accessdate=10 June 2014 | location=New York |work=Daily News |date=2014-03-16}}</ref> jogger pants,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fashion.allwomenstalk.com/reasons-to-rock-the-jogger-pant-trend |title=7 Reasons to Rock the Jogger Pant Trend |accessdate=January 8, 2015}}</ref> flat boots, [[stiletto heel|stiletto shoes]], [[high-water pants|high waisted]] [[short shorts]],<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2798106/jasmin-walia-shows-svelte-frame-crop-high-waisted-shorts-parties-essex.html Jasmin Walia]</ref> [[Nike Tempo shorts]], pastel and neon colored shorts, [[ballet flat]]s, and combat boots. Popular colors from 2015-16 included mauve, cream, eggplant, lime green, and warm grey.<ref>[http://www.pantone.com/downloads/support/FCR/PANTONE-Fashion-Color-Report-Fall-2015.pdf Pantone Color Report Fall 2015]</ref>
====Loom bands, snuggies and Onesies==== * [[Loom band]]s, bracelets woven from brightly colored [[rubber band]]s, were seen as both a global fashion statement and a children's fad.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2686823/Loom-bands-health-risk-says-GP-Parents-told-craze-damage-childrens-circulation-schools-introduce-bans.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=Loom bands are a health risk, says GP | date=2014-07-09}}</ref> Other brief fads of the mid 2010s included [[snuggie]] [[sleeved blanket]]s and the unisex [[onesie suit]].<ref>[http://www.burtonmail.co.uk/Onesie-fine-day-staff-McDonalds-Burton-dress/story-26238958-detail/story.html Onesie Day at Macdonalds]</ref> Originally envisioned as [[pajamas]], onesies were often purchased as a gag gift,<ref>[http://www.granthamjournal.co.uk/news/local/slideshow-one-night-in-a-onesie-wonders-raise-over-6-000-for-st-barnabas-grantham-hospice-1-6794984 One night in a onesie]</ref> and worn as casual streetwear<ref>[http://www.wigantoday.net/news/local/police-interview-tattooed-woman-in-a-onesie-1-7301898 Onesie burglar (Jun 25 2015)]</ref> by some younger women in the UK, Australia,<ref>[http://www.themandarin.com.au/35708-onesies-rule-discrimination-basis-fashion/?pgnc=1 Australian Department of Immigration bans onesies]</ref> and the US, including [[Amy Childs]], [[Kourtney Kardashian]],<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2836917/Pregnant-Kourtney-Kardashian-shows-bump-red-onesie-paired-horns-heads-pajama-party.html Kourtney]</ref> and [[Holly Carpenter]].<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-3129394/Model-reveals-hidden-meaning-women-s-snapchats.html Holly Carpenter in onesie]</ref>
==Men's clothing==
===Early 2010s (2010–12)=== [[File:Kendrick Lamar.jpg|thumbnail|Popular 2010's rapper [[Kendrick Lamar]] in 2012]]
====Neon colors==== * Neon colors and elaborate T-shirts were popular for much of the early 2010s, especially graphic print [[hoodie]]s, novelty socks, red or blue [[skinny jeans]], studded belts with large buckles, and [[Ed Hardy]] T-shirts embellished with [[rhinestone]]s.<ref>{{cite web|author=Adam Fox |url=http://www.askmen.com/fashion/fashiontip_400/480_what-not-to-wear.html |title=What not to wear |publisher=Askmen.com |date=2011-12-23 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> * Many styles from the late 2000s remained fashionable in Europe, Australasia, and the Americas, with brands such as [[Polo Ralph Lauren]] and [[J Crew]] being well favored.<ref>{{cite web|author=Adam Fox |url=http://www.askmen.com/fashion/trends_600/668_new-york-clothing-stores.html |title=New York clothing stores |publisher=Askmen.com |date=2011-12-23 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> Popular tops for men aged 20–50 included [[shawl collar]] [[cardigan (sweater)|cardigan]]s,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.askmen.com/fashion/apparel/j-crew-shawl-collar-cardigan.html |title=Review: J Crew shawl collar cardigan |publisher=Askmen.com |date=2011-12-23 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> V-neck ====1990s revival==== * In the summer of 2012, [[1990s in fashion|early 1990s inspired fashion]] made a comeback in the UK among men. This included bright colored short shorts, jeans shorts with a [[stone wash]] or [[acid wash]], shirts with [[Aztec]] patterns, [[Maya civilization|Mayan]] patterns, camouflage prints or animal prints, [[flannel]] shirts, [[high tops|high top sneakers]], [[Snapback (hat)|snapback hats]], and gaudy [[wristwatch]]es.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fashionbeans.com/2012/trending-era-the-90s/ |title=Men’s Fashion Trend: Channelling The 1990s |accessdate=23 May 2014}}</ref> * In America, the trend caught on in 2013. The [[1990s in fashion#Grunge Look|Grunge look]] had made a comeback due to the influence of [[Steves Peeps]], an American artist famous for designing the costumes of pop star [[Lady Gaga]].<ref>[http://www.buzzfeed.com/jasonsmith/interview-with-steves-peeps-3muj Steve Peeps interview]</ref> Common upper items of clothing include [[bomber jacket]]s, black leather jackets, [[crombie (clothing)|crombie]] overcoats, padded [[tartan]] [[overshirt]]s, [[crewneck]] [[sweatshirts]],<ref>[http://metro.co.uk/2014/11/17/its-official-there-will-be-200-more-christmas-jumpers-on-the-streets-this-year-4951164/ 200% increase in Xmas jumpers]</ref> oversized [[flannel]] shirts, [[throwback uniform|throwback]] [[basketball]] or [[baseball uniform]]s, and [[preppy]] [[Nantucket Reds]]. Other popular accessories of the early 2010s included [[Doc Martens]], [[The Timberland Company]], [[combat boot]]s, [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars|Converse All Stars]], [[Sperry Top-Siders]], [[Nike Elite]] crew socks, [[Snapback (hat)|snapback hats]] inspired by artists like [[Mac Miller]], brown [[Oxford shoe]]s, and classic [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]] trainers.<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/fashion/fashiontip/501-how-do-you-interpret-yours.html Levi jeans]</ref> Maroon [[baseball jacket]]s and ringer Tees featuring a specific sports team's logo were particularly popular in the Philippines due to the widespread media coverage of the [[University Athletic Association of the Philippines|UAAP Games]] athletes.<ref>[http://lifestyle.abs-cbn.com/articles/579/what-to-wear-to-the-uaap-games-look-to-angel-jane-gretchen-and-bianca-for-inspiration/ What to wear to the UAAP Games]</ref><ref>[http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/113427/wear-your-oblation-pride-on-your-sleeve Inquirer.net: UAAP Oblation Pride]</ref>
====Business casual==== * The [[business casual]] look of the 1990s and early 2000s remained common in many parts of America, with jeans, [[loafers]], [[boat shoe]]s and sneakers being seen as acceptable to wear in the workplace.<ref name=Devolution>{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/unchanged/2012/01/prisoners-of-style-201201 |title=You Say You Want a Devolution? |publisher=[[Vanity Fair (magazines)|Vanity Fair]] |date=December 31, 2011 |accessdate=2015-11-28}}</ref> The decline in the formality of men's fashion that started in the 1960s continued until 2012, with men wearing informal clothing on a regular basis, even at work or while travelling, as an apparent extension of [[Beau Brummell]]'s older idea that gentlemen shouldn't try to outshine the ladies for attention.<ref name=SecondRevolution>>{{cite web|url=http://takimag.com/article/the_second_revolution_in_menswear#ixzz1gVJ6DJZL |title=The Second Revolution in Menswear |publisher=[[Taki's Magazine]] |date=December 14, 2011 |accessdate=2015-11-28}}</ref> This contrasted to Britain, Italy, Europe, and the urban Northeastern US, where more formal [[Mad Men]] inspired business clothing such as slim-fitting grey suits had made a comeback in the workplace during the [[2000s in fashion#Slim-fit Suits|late 2000s and early 2010s]].<ref>See the "Mid-2010s" section covering formal wear.</ref>
===Mid 2010s (2013-16)===

Bright colors (especially the [[Ed Hardy]] shirts) went out of style in favor of black, white, [[beige]], [[taupe]], [[gray]], and various shades of dark [[green]]. Clothing items included tailored sweatpants, jersey shirts, chunky hiking boots with thick soles,<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/fashion-and-style/11316478/Ten-of-the-best-winter-work-boots-for-men.html?frame=3150290 Top 10 mens winter boots]</ref> [[bomber jacket]]s, leather jackets, denim jackets, thick oversized coats, double-breasted jackets and blazers,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dmarge.com/2014/12/2014-review-hottest-mens-fashion-trends.html |title=2014 IN REVIEW: THE news|url=http://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052702304831304579546312161483266|accessdate=2015-03-08|date=2014-05-09|title=A New Length for Men's Shorts|author=David Colman|work=The Wall Street ====Formal business wear==== [[File:16SS DAKS FASHION SHOW.JPG|thumb|300px|right|Male models walking in a Fashion Show]] * In the UK, Italy, Australia<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/top_10/entertainment/top-5-australian-fashion-week-trends-worth-trying_2.html Dapper rock star]</ref> and US, many professional men wear grey [[mohair]] or [[houndstooth]] [[office suit]]s, usually with two-button fastening, a single vent, and narrow lapels<ref name="5 killer suit tips">[http://www.mademan.com/dress-sharp-5-killer-suit-tips/ 5 killer suit tips]</ref> inspired by the American TV show [[Mad Men]], [[Hannibal (TV series)|Hannibal]], and [[Daniel Craig]] as [[James Bond]].<ref name="James Bond suits">[http://uk.askmen.com/fashion/galleries/how-to-get-a-tailored-suit.html James Bond suits]</ref><ref name="James Bond suits"/><ref>[http://www.esquire.com/style/fashion-story/2012-suits-for-men-0412#slide-12 New rules of suits, 2012]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.shortlist.com/style/get-the-boardwalk-empire-look |title=Boardwalk Empire look |publisher=Shortlist.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> Businessmen in Asian countries like the Philippines generally followed the trend, but dispensed with the necktie in favor of a semi-formal, simple shirt better suited to the hot tropical climate. As part of the general 1980s revival, the [[waistcoat]]<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/style/fashion_advice/fashion-sense-three-piece-suit.html Three piece suit]</ref> made a comeback as part of the [[three piece suit]] in Europe and the US.<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-1215158/As-Tesco-Aldi-launch-cut-price-ensembles-man-look-good-18-suit.html Tesco suit]</ref> In the early 2010s these suits were mostly [[charcoal grey]],<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/grooming/appearance/wardrobe-mistakes.html Wardrobe mistakes]</ref> steel grey and silver, but by 2014 these were joined by [[air force blue]], [[navy blue]],<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/style/fashion_trends/2015-suit-styles.html 2015 suits]</ref> [[midnight blue]],<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/video/entertainment-and-celebrities/saville-rows-finest-tailors-skyfalls-midnight-blue-tuxedo.html Savile Row]</ref> and sky blue. *In the UK, US and Germany, the suits of the mid 2010s often featured checks,<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/fashion/apparel/drykorn-e-boston-suit.html Drykorn suit]</ref> [[houndstooth]], [[Glen plaid]], [[bird's eye]], [[Prince of Wales]] [[plaid cloth]],<ref>[uk.askmen.com/style/fashion_trends/2015-suit-styles.html Plaid suit]</ref> or [[windowpane tweed]],<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/fashion/essentials_2013/blazers-suits-26.html Plaid blazer]</ref> and the stripes on [[pinstripe]] suits became narrower<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/fashion/fashiontip_250/266_fashion_advice.html 7 rules for wearing stripes]</ref> and more closely spaced.<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/fashion/fashiontip_300/398_fashion_advice.html Pinstripe suits]</ref> Thin ties remained the norm, but the simple [[notch lapel]]s of 2010 were increasingly replaced by [[shawl collar]]s and [[peak lapel]]s on single breasted three piece suits.<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/top_10/celebrity/top-5-celebrity-fashion-picks-george-lamb.html George Lamb]</ref>

earth-tones like grey, burgundy, brown, teal, and beige.<ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/fine_living/galleries/hipster-s-guide-to-america.html Hipsters guide to America]</ref> [[tweed cloth|Tweed]] jackets, [[leggings]],<ref>[http://fashion.telegraph.co.uk/news-features/TMG9731615/Men-in-tights-how-meggings-are-taking-fashion-by-storm.html Men in tights]</ref> and [[Knit cap|beanies]] replaced the <ref>[http://uk.askmen.com/fashion/trends_500/553_hipster-trends-we-hate.html hipster trends we hate]</ref> [[winklepickers]], [[velvet]] jackets, [[Ray-Ban Aviator|Aviator sunglasses]], and skinny ===Classic preppy=== {{Main|Preppy}}
* During the early and mid 2010s, American [[preppy]] guys have moved away from the [[hip-hop]] influenced fashions of the early 2000s and begun to dress in a more classic 1950s [[Ivy League]] style<ref>{{cite web|last=Pompeo |first=Joe |url=http://www.observer.com/2009/fashion/trad-men |title=American Trad |publisher=Observer.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> with [[sweater]]s, [[Sperry Top-Sider]] [[boat shoes]], [[Aran sweater]]s, [[cardigan (sweater)|cardigan]]s, [[Oxford shirt]]s, Cricket [[Sweater|pullovers]], [[wingtip]]s, stripy [[polo shirt]]s, hats like the [[fedora]], khaki or pastel colored [[Vineyard Vines]], [[Nantucket Reds]], white or bright pastel color socks worn with sneakers and [[Sperry Top-Sider boat shoes]], colored jeans, white [[Nike Elite]] crew socks, [[baseball jacket]]s, khaki [[cargo shorts]], and tapered [[chinos]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theivyleaguelook.blogspot.com/ |title=Ivy League look |publisher=Theivyleaguelook.blogspot.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> * Preppy girls wear [[flip flops]], [[ballet flats]], [[Keds]], [[Sperry Top-Sider]] [[boat shoes]], layered shirts and tees, [[capri pants]], ankle length pants and colored jeans, opaque or footless [[tights]], [[tweed cloth]] or [[kilt|plaid skirt]]s, skater dresses, baby doll dresses, cotton shorts in pastel colors, [[Uggs]], [[Hunter brand]] [[rain boots]], [[leg warmers]], white or pastel colored [[skinny jeans]], [[railroad stripe]] blouses, [[knee socks]], flat knee high [[riding boots]], [[jeggings]], capri or ankle length [[leggings]] worn with shorts, dresses and skirts, oversized sweaters, [[bike shorts]] with or without lace trim, 3/4 length sleeved shirts, tees and polos, [[Nike Tempo]] shorts, and sweatshirts bearing the name and crest of the school or college. In many schools with uniforms in colder weather students wear the school polo shirt underneath a school crew neck sweatshirt with the polos collar folded over the sweatshirt collar.

[[Sleeveless shirt|A-shirts]], plain hoodies, [[combat boot]]s, Vans, skinny jeans, and [[stretching (body piercing)|stretched earlobe piercings]].<ref name="Fashion">{{cite web|author=Fashion|url=http://caniwear.it/wiki/hardcore-punk/ |title=Hardcore punk fashion |publisher=Caniwear.it |date=2011-01-12 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> *'''[[Seapunk]],''' a fusion of scene, of seapunk]</ref> Seapunks often combined brightly dyed androgynous hairstyles<ref>[http://www.theguardian.com/culture/2014/mar/20/youth-subcultures-where-have-they-gone 2010s subcultures]</ref> with nautical themes such as mermaids or dolphins, plastic [[Ray Ban wayfarers]], [[undercut (hairstyle)|undercut]] hairstyles, shell jewelery, feathers, [[tartan]] overshirts associated with the [[surfer]] subculture, 1990s inspired [[yin-yang]] T-shirts, [[baseball cap]]s, [[tie dye]], transparent plastic jackets,<ref>[http://theclustermag.com/2011/12/the-abyss-seapunk-splishsplash-oceangang/ The Abyss]</ref> lots of green, blue, turquoise, [[cyan]] or [[aquamarine (color)|aquamarine]] clothing, [[smiley]] motifs, and red and blue 3-Dimensional images.<ref>[http://www.spin.com/articles/azealia-banks-rihanna-seapunk-beef-saturday-night-live-video/ Seapunks salty over Rihanna]</ref>
===Hip-hop=== {{Main|Hip hop fashion}} [[File:Tyga 2013.jpg|thumb|American rapper [[Tyga]] in 2013]] * Hip hop fans wear [[tactical pants]], [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]], [[Air Jordans]], [[Ralph Lauren]] Polo Boots, strapback caps, Obey and Diamond Supply Co. [[T-shirt]]s and snapbacks, [[Hollister Co.|Hollister]] T-shirts, and [[goggle jacket]]s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metro.co.uk/news/79052-new-gas-mask-hoodies-intimidating |title=Gas mask hoodies |publisher=Metro.co.uk |date=2007-12-09 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/uk/article3022226.ece |title=Goggle jackets in the Times |publisher=Timesonline.co.uk |date=1977-04-06 |accessdate=2012-01-21 |location=London}}</ref> [[Retro]] 1980s and 1990s fashions like snapbacks, skinny acid-wash jeans, [[bucket hat]]s,strapback caps, [[baseball jacket]]s, nylon [[tracksuits]], varsity jackets, Vans, [[Chuck Taylors]], rain boots, retro Nikes, Shell tube socks, leather jackets, Levis, [[Adidas]] and [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]] apparel, gold chains, Ray Ban sunglasses, [[Air Jordans]], and over-sized sweaters, and colors such as red, green, and yellow, made a comeback in the African American community due to the influence of [[drum and bass]], [[rave music]], and [[indie pop]]-inspired rappers. Independent brands have risen to popularity, as well as floral print items and tie-dye items. Button-down shirts are often worn fully buttoned. * Fashion designers such as [[Riccardo Tisci]] and [[Rick Owens]] begin to gain a new popularity within hip hop, popularized by rappers such as [[Kanye West]] and [[A$AP Rocky]]. Such designers inspire a "darker" aesthetic involving monochromatic colour schemes (usually black or grey), extra-long shirts usually sporting over-sized neck openings and asymmetrical hems, skinny jeans that are worn with long inseams and an aggressive taper to cause bunching up or "stacks" near the ankle (a style heavily popularized and sported by Kanye) and high-top sneakers. Black boots, leather jackets, denim vests, bombers, monochrome sports jerseys, waxed jeans, black varsity jackets, tapered sweatpants, drop-crotch trousers, layering shorts over leggings and occasionally floral print are all popular trends within this style as well. Other notable rappers that sport this look include [[Kendrick Lamar]], [[Danny Brown (rapper)|Danny Brown]], and [[Pusha T]].
===Cholo and chicano=== {{Main|Mexican pointy boots}} * In Mexico and the Southwestern US during the early 2010s, many members of the [[cholo]], [[chicano]] and [[lowrider]] subcultures combine [[hip-hop fashion]] with [[Western shirt]]s, traditional [[charro]] jackets, [[Stetson]] hats, [[skinny jeans]],<ref>{{cite web|last=Gee |first=Are |url=http://everydayreal.blogspot.com/2010/06/style-watch-chuntaro-style.html |title=Chuntaro style |publisher=Everydayreal.blogspot.com |date=2010-06-10 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> and [[Cowboy boots]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-1387604/How-Mexican-men-embraced-bizarre-trend-pointed-footwear |title=html Mexican men wearing pointed boots |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date= 2011-05-16|accessdate=2012-01-21 |location=London}}</ref> with elongated toes. These 3 ft long "[[Mexican pointy boots]]," associated with [[Tribal-guarachero]] music are an extreme version of the '60s-inspired [[Winklepickers]] popular in mid-2000s Britain.<ref>[http://www.theblaze.com/stories/2011/05/16/your-eyes-arent-deceiving-you-3-feet-long-pointy-boots-are-the-craze-in-mexico/]</ref> * By 2015, many young [[chicano]]s on the American West Coast had abandoned the garish Western inspired clubwear in favor of a more authentic 1950s inspired look. [[Pachuco]] style [[Zoot suit]]s, [[fedora]]s and [[panama hat]]s made a comeback,<ref>[http://compasscultura.com/east-los-angeles-beat-barrio/ Beat of the Barrio]</ref> together with more typical casual [[rockabilly]] fashions for everyday wear such as slim jeans, black leather jackets, [[bowling shirt]]s, brightly colored blouses and flouncy skirts for girls, [[polka dot]] dresses with petticoats, and flowers worn in the hair.<ref>[http://latino.foxnews.com/latino/lifestyle/2015/10/22/barrio-boogie-back-proud-chicanos-reenact-bygone-pachuco-days-in-la/ Barrio boogie]</ref>
===K-pop and Jejemon=== [[File:PSY GangnamStyle Suwon15logo (8031994935).jpg|thumb|right|K-Pop singer Psy]] * Due to the spread of [[Hallyu Wave]] worldwide, millions of Asian and Asian-American youths have become addicted to [[K-Pop]]. These are the people who love listening to South Korean music and follow the style of artists and pop groups like [[Big Bang]], [[Wonder Girls]], [[Kim Soo Hyun]], or [[Gangnam Style]] singer [[Psy (rapper)|Psy]].<ref>[http://www.hngn.com/articles/141702/20151019/kpop-kim-soo-hyun-former-wonder-girls-sohee-dating.htm Kim Soo Hyun]</ref> Since the Korean girl and boy bands wore extravagant clothing, some of the hardcore fans in China, Korea, America and the Philippines tried to copy their idols and started wearing K-Pop style hairstyles and clothing.<ref>[http://www.newyorker.com/news/evan-osnos/why-china-lacks-gangnam-style China lacks gangnam style]</ref> These included skull, floral or honeycomb prints, monochromatic shirts, silk jackets featuring stylized Asian art prints or [[pop art]],<ref>[http://style.mtv.com/2013/06/27/g-dragon-ambush-clothing/ MTV K-pop clothing]</ref> leather skirts, black and neon printed leggings, retro joggers, short shorts, black and gold jewelery, brightly colored [[tuxedo]] jackets, tracksuits, basketball shirts, leather caps, and sequined or glitter jackets.<ref>[http://www.theguardian.com/music/2015/oct/13/big-bang-review-k-pop-heroes-deliver-candyfloss-hooks Big Bang]</ref><ref>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/music/a-year-after-gangnam-style-k-pop-continues-to-make-its-mark-in-america/2013/11/07/cb161c56-431f-11e3-a751-f032898f2dbc_story.html K-pop in America]</ref> *During the early part of the 2010s, a new youth subculture called [[Jejemon]] arose in the Philippines, sparking a brief [[moral panic]] among some older conservatives and other youths.<ref>[http://iskwiki.upd.edu.ph/index.php/A_WORLD_WITHIN_THE_WORLD_THE_JEJEMONS_AS_THE_OTHER_CULTURE#.ViV8Oyt2FIE Jejemon as the other]</ref> The Philippine Daily Inquirer describes Jejemons as a "new breed of hipster who have developed not only their own language and written text but also their own subculture and fashion.<ref>[http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/192844/lifestyle/artandculture/we-are-all-jejemons We are all Jejemons]</ref> These predominantly working class youths are associated with wearing trucker hats and use their own language through texting and via social media such as [[Facebook]].<ref>[https://globalvoices.org/2010/05/16/philippines-the-jejemon-craze/ Jejemon craze]</ref> They are often criticized by others for not using the words properly; even the Department of Education discouraged use of the Jejemon language. Apart from the language, the Jejemons were also criticized for their fashion and manners. From early 2013 onwards, with the rise of smartphones which began to overtake feature phones in terms of sales in the country, the phenomenon seems to have made a gradual decline in mainstream popularity.
==2010s beauty trends==
===Hairstyles===

Bangs were often either side swept or left straight down above the eyes,<ref>http://www.allure.com/beauty-trends/blogs/daily-beauty-reporter/2015/02/fifty-shades-of-grey-bangs.html</ref> and many women also use [[hair extensions]] to make their hair look much longer and fuller.<ref>http://www.slate.com/articles/life/doonan/2012/05/hair_extensions_why_are_they_so_insanely_popular_.html</ref> In America<ref>[http://www.marieclaire.com/beauty/hair/g412/curly-hair-how-to-hairstyles/?slide=2 Gwen Stefani]</ref> and Israel,<ref>[http://jewcy.com/jewish-news/the-new-york-times-dont-stress-curly-hair-is-cool New York Times]</ref> volumized curly hair,<ref>[http://www.sofeminine.co.uk/beauty/album733399/hairstyles-2013-haircuts-2013-women-hair-styles-2013-17351513.html#p52 So Feminine]</ref> [[perm]]s and crimped hair were briefly fashionable from 2010–12,<ref>[http://www.allure.com/hair-ideas/2012/the-best-haircuts-for-curly-hair#slide=5 10 haircuts for curly hair]</ref> especially in [[New York]].<ref>[http://www.essence.com/2011/05/10/hot-hair-street-style-curly-hair Essence street style 2011]</ref><ref>[http://www.stylisheve.com/2012-curly-hairstyles-for-women/ Curly womens hairstyles]</ref> Traditional and intricate styles such as a [[bun (hairstyle)|bun]], [[chignon (hairstyle)|chignon]], [[French twist (hairstyle)|French twist]], [[updo]], [[crown braid]], or [[French braid]], inspired by [[the Hunger Games]]' [[Katniss Everdeen]], are also popular among young women and girls.<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2507394/From-Minnie-Mouse-Buns-Katniss-braids-Mother-shows-create-unique-hairstyles-using-daughters-models.html Unique hairstyles]</ref><ref>[https://uk.celebrity.yahoo.com/gossip/omg/megan-fox-looks-unrecognisable-with-blonde-hair-in-full-1980s-style-153310836.html Megan Fox]</ref>
By the mid 2010s, straight and wavy hairstyles were dominant globally.<ref>http://hollywoodlife.com/2015/12/04/selena-gomez-straight-hair-dark-red-lips-jingle-ball-2015-pics/</ref><ref>http://www.allure.com/hair-ideas/2012/the-best-haircuts-for-curly-hair#slide=10</ref> It also became increasingly fashionable for European, Asian<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2723542/Dami-Im-poses-storm-outside-Sony-Music-studios-wearing-colourful-skirt-thigh-high-split-tight-top.html Dami]</ref> and American women to cut their hair into shorter styles,<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2719583/Amber-Rose-covers-day-husband-showed-world-revealing-photograph-her.html Amber Rose]</ref> such as the [[pixie cut]],<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2718111/Mixing-Kate-Peck-drops-grunge-glamour-chic-tight-fitting-dress-keeps-captivating-pixie-hair-do.html katie peck]</ref><ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2711313/Seal-shares-kiss-young-mystery-blonde-cosy-holiday-stroll-Sardinia-children.html Young blonde woman]</ref> [[crop (hair)|crop]],<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2702710/Jennifer-Hudson-rocks-edgier-vibe-airport-pairs-abs-flashing-loose-vest-grunge-boots.html Jennifer Hudson]</ref> [[bob Korea]</ref><ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2724653/Abs-fab-Rose-McGowan-s-washboard-stomach-steals-wows-orange-leather-skirt-crop-dinner.html Rose Mcgowan]</ref> or the [[Undercut (haircut)|undercut]].<ref>http://www.theglow.com.au/hair-and-nails/undercut-hairstyle-women/</ref><ref>http://www.business2community.com/entertainment/miley-cyrus-shaves-head-for-an-edgy-undercut-0250945</ref><ref>http://zap2it.com/2012/09/miley-cyrus-blasts-pink-copycat-critics-after-mtv-video-music-awards/</ref> Solid colored hair was generally considered the most fashionable in the early years of the decade, but from 2012-15 it became increasingly common for American women to dye their hair in an [[ombré]] style, sometimes with highlights.
From 2012-16, many [[African-American]], Black Canadian,<ref>[http://www.torontosun.com/2015/12/04/tdsb-accused-of-targeting-black-students-hair-styles Toronto Sun]</ref> and [[Afro-Caribbean]] British women favored natural, [[Afro-textured hair]]<ref>[http://www.marieclaire.com/beauty/hair/how-to/g416/black-hairstyles-and-haircuts/ Marie Clare]</ref> and [[dreadlocks]]<ref>[http://www.blackenterprise.com/news/marine-corps-authorizes-lock-and-twist-hairstyles-for-women/ Dreadlocks authorized in military]</ref> in reaction to the damage caused by relaxers which were extremely popular in the early 2000s, opting instead for natural products to style their hair. During the mid 2010s, some also choose to wear weaves and wigs to achieve their desired looks without having the damage of relaxers.

grooming trends">{{cite web|author=Adam Fox |url=http://www.askmen.com/grooming/appearance_60/77_2011-spring-grooming-trends.html |title=Spring grooming trends |publisher=Askmen.com |date= haircut]] and [[buzzcut]] are relatively popular among balding men, or the side parted hair with some volume on the top.
For [[African-American]] men, [[mohawk hairstyle|mohawk]] variants of the [[Afro]], The [[360 Waves]], [[jheri curl]] and The Taper are popular in the 2010s, as are shaved patterns or "steps" into variants of the buzzcut. The [[High Top Fade]], often with a bleached blonde streak inspired by [[Wiz Khalifa]], came back into style among African American youth on the West Coast.
In the mid 2010s, some men wore their hair in a type of [[Chonmage|topknot]] or "man bun"<ref>[http://www.mensxp.com/grooming/hair-care/21433-hairstyle-in-focus-the-man-bun.html Man bun]</ref> reminiscent of the [[samurai hairstyle]]s<ref>[http://www.manlycurls.com/2013/04/samurai-hairstyle-curly-men-hair-bun/ Samurai bun]</ref> in [[wuxia]] movies. This trend was popularised by celebrities including actor [[Orlando Bloom]], [[Jared Leto]], [[TOWIE]]'s [[Joey Essex]],<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2570190/Joey-Essex-sports-tiniest-ponytails-rest-hair-slicked-steps-belted-leather-jacket.html Joey Essex]</ref> and pop singers [[Harry Styles]]<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2555336/Rise-Man-Bun.html Man bun]</ref> and [[Zayn Malik]].
====Youth==== For young girls, tween and teen girls, and college girls the [[bangs (hairstyle)|bangs]] and thin [[headband]] combination has remained popular. Braids, side ponytails, and a single chunky side braid are popular styles with longer hair. Side parting hair is popular, and [[ponytail]]s are often worn when exercising or playing sports. The chin length [[bob cut]], long hair with choppy side bangs, and straight middle parted longer hair are also popular styles in the US, UK, New Zealand and Australia.{{citation needed|date=October 2015}}
In the UK, Middle East,<ref>[http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/explainer/2010/07/whence_the_mullet.html Iran bans mullets]</ref> and Australia during the early 2010s, a type of short [[mullet haircut]] with buzzed sides and bleached blond streaks became popular among male [[chav]]s, teenage [[Irish travellers]], and urban youths of Iranian<ref>[http://www.theguardian.com/world/2010/jul/06/iran-bans-the-mullet The Guardian]</ref> and Lebanese descent<ref>[http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2009/03/01/1235842248410.html Sydney Morning Herald]</ref> inspired by [[The Combination (film)|The Combination]] crime film.<ref>[https://www.wsws.org/en/articles/2009/04/comb-a02.html The Combination]</ref> By 2012, a long [[undercut (haircut)|undercut]] or [[Mohawk hairstyle|mohawk]]-like haircut, in which only one side of the head is buzzed, became popular among circles of [[rave]]rs, [[metalcore]], and [[dubstep]] fans in the US, inspired by [[Skrillex]].{{citation needed|date=September 2014}} The [[emo]] style [[fringe (hair)|fringe]]s also went out of fashion around the same time.<ref>{{cite web|author=Farah Averill |url=http://www.askmen.com/fashion/fashiontip_400/469b_hairstyles-women-hate.html |title=Hairstyles women hate |publisher=Askmen.com |date=2011-12-23 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref><ref>[http://www.novafm.com.au/article_my-chemical-romance-say-emo-is-dead-warn-the-angry-kids_104760 MCR say emo is dead]</ref>
For boys, teen guys and college guys in The United States, Canada, Australasia, the UK and Korea,<ref>[http://www.nknews.org/2014/03/why-kim-jong-un-hairstyle-order-is-unlikely-true/ Kim Jong Un haircut popular among Korean college students]</ref> the [[Undercut (haircut)|layered short hair style]], the [[buzzcut|buzzed short hairstyle which is blended from the sides to the top]],<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/asia-pacific/4157121.stm War on long hair]</ref> and the [[Blowout (hairstyle)]] became popular during the mid 2010s due to continued interest in 1980s and [[1990s fashion]]. Additionally the [[Mod haircut|side swept bangs]], the [[quiff]], and the [[surfer hair|layered longer hair]]<ref>[http://www.kidzcuts.co.nz/boys.html]</ref> of the late 2000s remain fashionable among American [[preppy]] guys.
===Makeup and cosmetics=== In Britain, the minimalist makeup, neon 1980s inspired colors, and smoky eye look of the late 2000s carried on as a trend in many parts of the country. In other areas, these went out of fashion as women sought to imitate the [[fake tan]] and thick "Scouse brow" popularized by [[Kate Middleton]] and the cast of ''[[The Only Way is Essex]]'' and ''[[Desperate Scousewives]]''.<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2173045/The-Kate-effect-Sales-eyebrow-products-600-women-rush-recreate-Duchesss-sophisticated-Scouse-Brow.html The Kate effect]</ref>
===Body modifications=== Continuing on from the 1990s and 2000s, [[body modification]]s remained popular among many teenagers<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2639204/Willow-Smith-13-wears-nose-ring-paired-Rasta-accessories-shops-flea-market.html Willow Smith]</ref> and blue collar men and women in Britain,<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2721164/Weve-bricks-eggs-thrown-house-dress-Couple-live-entire-life-1950s-clothing-overcome-horrendous-abuse-win-national-vintage-competition.html Mr and Mrs Vintage UK]</ref> Japan,<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2545271/The-worlds-spectacular-tattoos-revealed.html Most spectacular tattoos]</ref> Israel,<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3113947/Tat-s-got-hurt-Man-hangs-MEAT-HOOKS-model-tattooed-eyeballs-gets-ink-added-face-Israeli-body-art-convention.html Israeli tattoo convention]</ref> New Zealand and Australia.<ref name=Devolution/><ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2727033/Tattoo-artists-enthusiasts-world-come-celebrate-culture-body-ink.html Australian tattooists]</ref> [[Old school tattoo]]s were popularised by female celebrities like [[Kat Von Dee]]<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2042158/Did-love-rat-Jesse-James-cheat-Kat-Von-D.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=Did love rat Jesse James cheat on Kat Von D? | date=2011-09-26}}</ref> imitating the [[pinup girl]]s of the 1950s,<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1325266/Jesse-Jamess-tattooed-girlfriend-Kat-Von-D-puss-kinky-boots.html Kat Von Dee]</ref> and by men like footballer [[David Beckham]],<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2737830/David-Beckham-falls-motorbike-leaves-Hollywood-tattoo-parlour-escapes-unharmed.html Beckham tattoo]</ref> pop star Harry Styles<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2290950/Harry-Styles-gets-tattoo-reveals-HUGE-butterfly-design-stomach.html Harry's butterfly tat]</ref> or [[Justin Bieber]] aspiring for the "tough guy" look.<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2516059/Justin-Bieber-posts-picture-getting-tattoo-Sydney-concert.html Bieber Tat]</ref> The [[earring]]s and [[tongue piercing]]s<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1271239/Tongue-piercing-ruptures-vein-leaving-schoolgirl-needing-surgery.html Tongue piercing]</ref> that had gained mainstream acceptance in the late 2000s were joined by more extreme modifications such as [[Stretching (body piercing)|stretched piercings]], [[flesh tunnel]]s, [[lip piercing]]s, and [[nose piercing]]s, despite the risk of hindering a teenager's career prospects.<ref>[http://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/active/mens-health/10849816/Look-at-those-lugholes.html Look at those lugholes]</ref>
===Facial hair=== In many western countries, the US, and Eastern Europe,<ref>[https://uk.news.yahoo.com/metrosexuals-gone-europe-agog-beards-081902643.html Beards in Poland]</ref> the growing of a [[Beard|full beard]] became a popular trend amongst young males in the early-to-mid 2010s, with some suggesting this was due to the influence of the hipster subculture, the [[lumbersexual]] ideal, and the [[Movember]] campaign.<ref>http://m.scotsman.com/news/careless-whiskers-why-beards-are-back-in-fashion-1-3224369</ref><ref>http://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2014/apr/16/hipster-beard-guys-growing-a-beard</ref> An increase in facial hair transplants was reported in the United Kingdom in the first three years of the decade,<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2582161/The-Ben-Affleck-effect-4-500-beard-transplants-carried-UK-men-cool-factor.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=4,500 beard transplants carried out in UK as men up 'cool factor' | date=2014-03-16}}</ref> and the trend approached what researchers predicted would be a 'peak' level of desirability.<ref>http://www.theguardian.com/fashion/2014/apr/16/fashion-conscious-men-warned-we-may-have-reached-peak-beard</ref><ref>[http://metro.co.uk/2014/11/19/new-social-networking-site-match-makes-beards-with-those-who-love-stroking-them-4954175/ Social networking for beard lovers]</ref>

[[File:2008-09-02 Two RVs for sale by owner (cropped).jpg|thumb|300px|[[Recreational vehicle]]s can be used for recreational travel]] '''Recreational travel''' involves [[travel]] for [[pleasure]] and [[recreation]]. Following the introduction of [[rail transport]] (note the concept of the [[railway excursion]]), the [[automobile]] has made recreational travel more available for people worldwide. Automobiles also allow the easy hauling of [[Trailer (vehicle)|trailers]], [http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/45050/automotive-industry/65790/Recreational-travel "Automobile."] (Recreational travel section). [http://www.britannica.com Encyclopædia Britannica]. Accessed July 2011. [[travel trailer]]s, [[popup camper]]s, [[off-road vehicles]], [[boat]]s and [[bicycle]]s, which fosters recreational travel. == Terminology == Merriam-Webster's ''Dictionary of Synonyms'' suggests the word "'''trip'''" as particularly appropriate with reference to relatively short journeys, especially connotating business or pleasure. {{cite book | chapter = journey | title = Merriam-Webster's Dictionary of Synonyms: A Dictionary of Discriminated Synonyms with Antonyms and Analogous and Contrasted Words | url = http://books.google.com/books?id=8N4UReTJYhUC | publisher = Merriam-Webster | publication-date = 1984 | page = 474 | isbn = 9780877793410 | accessdate = 2014-01-23 | quote = '''Trip''' is the preferable word when referring to a relatively short journey, especially one for business or pleasure. }} == See also == * [[Day-tripper]] * [[Tourism]] ==See also==

{{Infobox music festival | music_festival_name = [[Image:Sunburnfestivallogo.jpg|240px|Sunburn Music Festival Logo]] | image = [[Image:Sunburnfestivalstage.JPG|240px]] | name = Sunburn Festival | Location = Goa | caption = Sunburn Festival Goa | location = [[Vagator]], [[Goa]] | years_active = 2007 - Present | dates = 27th to 30th December | participants = [[Armin Van Buuren]], [[Above & Beyond]], [[Ferry Corsten]], [[Axwell]], [[Shapeshifters]], [[Sander Van Doorn]] | genre = [[Electronic Dance]], [[Trance music|Trance]], [[House music|House]], [[Dubstep]], [[Tech house]], [[Future House]], [[Trap music]], [[Progressive house]], [[psychedelic trance]] | website = [http://sunburn.in/ sunburn.in] }}
'''Sunburn''' is a [[Commerce|commercial]] EDM ([[electronic dance music]]) Festival held in the [[beach]] and party destination [[Vagator]], [[Goa]]. It was previously in [[Candolim]], [[Goa]], [[India]] every year. It is [[Asia]]'s largest [[music]] [[festival]]. The festival is an amalgamation of [[Music]], [[Entertainment]], [[Food]] and [[Shopping]], and was ranked by [[CNN]] in 2009 as one of the Top 10 Festivals in world .<ref>[http://articles.cnn.com/2009-05-07/travel/summer.festivals_1_year-s-festival-music-festivals-major-festival/3?_s=PM:TRAVEL CNN Article]</ref> The Festival is organized by Percept company owned by [[Shailendra Singh (singer)]] . Spread over 4 days, the festival has multiple stages with artists playing simultaneously.<ref name="sb2013">{{cite web|title=Sunburn 2013: Goa gears up for Asia's Largest Music Festival|url=http://news.biharprabha.com/2013/12/sunburn-2013-goa-gears-up-for-asias-largest-music-festival/|work=Biharprabha News|accessdate=24 December 2013}}</ref>
==History== Electronic music parties/events/festivals are not new to Goa and much earlier pioneers of [[Free party|free party's/events/festivals]] with live DJ's mixing, art,craft's and food stalls started in the late 1980s and continued through all of the 1990s into the early 2000s where they played [[Goa trance]], [[Psychedelic trance]], and [[Techno]] and were held at [[Vagator Beach Goa|Vagator Beach]], [[Anjuna|Anjuna beach]] and [[Arambol|Arambol beach]]. The arrival of commercialized events such as Sunburn arrived in Goa when mainstream EDM gained more widespread popularity within India.
===Sunburn Goa 2007=== In 2007, Nikhil Chinapa; the godfather of dance music in India, organized the first International Dance Music Festival in Goa, India. Sunburn Goa 2007 was sponsored by [[Smirnoff]] and took place on December 28–29 at [[Candolim|Candolim Beach]]. In its first year Sunburn included performances from [[Carl Cox]], [[Above & Beyond (band)|Above & Beyond]] and [[Axwell]] as headline acts. Other acts included [[John 00 Fleming]], Pete Gooding, [[DJ Pearl]], [[Jalebee Cartel]], Super 8 & Tab, held on two stages with DJ's playing simultaneously. The festival was hosted by [[Nikhil Chinapa]] and Rohit Barker. The line-up announcement and early bird passes commenced during the end of October.
===Sunburn Goa 2008=== Sunburn Goa 2008 was held despite the [[2008 Mumbai terrorist attacks]] which took place exactly a month prior to the festival. The festival was themed Electric Circus and was held on two main stages: "Banyan Tree" for Trance acts and "Circus Stage" for [[House music]]. The event also included a flea market and beach volleyball games. Having tied up with [[Defected Records]] in 2008, the label brought house DJ's Simon Dunmore, [[Shapeshifters]], Copyright and percussionist Shovel playing. Headlining the festival were [[GMS (music group)|GMS]], [[Gareth Emery]] and John 00 Fleming. The acts were Digital Blonde, Roger Shah, [[Pearl]], Brute Force, Nawed Khan, Vachan Chinnappa, [[Jalebee Cartel]], Sanjay Dutta, and Ma Faiza. The visuals were produced by Dan booth, Martin Robins, Vj Kaycee & Inferno. Sunburn Goa 2008 took place on 27–29 December at [[Candolim]] Beach Goa. The title sponsors of Sunburn Goa 2008 were Fly [[Kingfisher]], [[Carlsberg Group|Carlsberg]] and [[Force India]].
===Sunburn Goa 2009=== Sunburn Goa 2009 had turnout of over 22,000 fans.{{citation needed|date=August 2011}} It also saw the launch of "After Dark" parties which took place at club Butter from 10.30 pm until 5 am, making Sunburn a 24-hour festival. Sunburn brought DJ [[Armin Van Buuren]], who headlined the festival along with Latin House DJ's Roger Sanchez and John 00 Fleming. Sunburn’s line-up also included tech house DJ Sultan and [[Trance]] DJ [[Sander Van Doorn]]. Previously in 2008, Sunburn had tied up with [[Defected Records]], but in 2009 Sunburn tied up with UK clubbing company [[Gatecrashers]]. Acts included [[Jalebee Cartel]], [[DJ Pearl]], [[Ma Faiza]], Nawed Khan and Designer Hippies. The festival was hosted by [[Nikhil Chinapa]] and Rohit Barker. In addition to the previous year’s attractions, Sunburn Goa 2009 included a rock climbing wall and Thai foot masseurs.
===Sunburn Goa 2010===
Sunburn Goa 2010, took place on 27–29 December at Candolim Beach. The festival was sponsored by [[Tuborg]]. The headliners of the 2010 festival were [[Paul Van Dyk]], [[Ferry Corsten]] and [[Axwell]] along with [[Sultan & Ned Shepard]] with [[Nadia Ali]](Live), [[Richard Durand]], [[GMS (music group)|GMS]], Pete Gooding, Aly & Fila and DJ's [[DJ Pearl|Pearl]], [[Ma Faiza]], [[Anish Sood]] and Sanjay Dutta.
For the 2010 festival, Precept ran a "Sunburn Anthem Contest"<ref>Afternoon Articles http://www.afternoondc.in/48-hrs/burn-it-up/article_14722</ref> for potential audio and visual producers, with participants in the visual category allowed to make a visual for a B.R.E.E.D track which is then submitted to a panel of judges. Participants in the audio category are asked to make a fresh remix of Nadia Ali’s ‘Love Story’ which is the Anthem of the festival.
A fashion show was organized on 27 December at Club Butter. Sunburn passes went live on 5 November 2010 with the early bird passes and pre-booking sale passes being sold out in 22 minutes.<ref>[http://www.ragatorock.com/hnews.asp?id=2307]</ref>
===Sunburn Goa 2011===
Sunburn Goa 2011 was held on 27–29 December at [[Candolim]] Beach. The main attraction was Above & Beyond, Axwell, Infected Mushroom, Spartaque
===Sunburn Goa 2012=== Sunburn Festival 2012 was held in Candolim, [[Goa, India]] during Dec 27, 28 &29th.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunburn 2012|url=https://www.facebook.com/events/268600889921622/}}</ref> Headlining acts in 2012 were by Sander Van Doorn, BT, Fedde Le Grand, W & W, Paul Van dyk, Roger Sanchez. After-parties for Sunburn 2012 were held at LPK( Love Passion Karma ) and Sinq .
===Sunburn Goa 2013=== The 7th Edition of Sunburn at Goa took place in [[Vagator]] witnessed around 120 Artists and over 200 hours of Music. it had over 10,000sq.m,of exotic festival area with 7 massive stages.headline DJ's were [[Afrojack]], [[Axwell]], [[Pete Tong]], [[Ummet Ozcan]] and many more Over 1 Lakh participants were expected.<ref name="sb2013"/>
===Sunburn concerts in IITs, NITs, IIMs & Other Colleges=== Many IITs,NITs IIIT and few AIIMS also witnessed numerous Indian and International artists. BITS Pilani Goa Campus was the first college to ever host the sunburn on campus. This strategy by Sunburn helps grow the craze of [[Electronic Dance Music]] in teenagers and it also shows a new modern trend evolving in colleges throughout India.NIT Caliut hosted Sunburn in October 2013((ft.DJ Clement)) as a part of their Annual Technical Festival Tathva.Thakur College of Engineering & Technology- Mumbai hosted Sunburn in September 2013 (featuring DJ Candice Redding and NDS & BLU) additionally, BITS Pilani, Pilani Campus also successfully hosted Sunburn during Oasis 2014, the annual cultural festival of BITS PILANI. Annual cultural fest of [[LNMIIT]] Vivacity was first to host sunburn festival in [[Rajasthan]] in 2015. Candice Redding along with DJ Shaan had performed in the second edition of Sunburn at Vivacity 2016. This was the only time when passes of Sunburn was free of cost. NIT Trichy hosted Sunburn (featuring DJ Candice Redding) during Festember '14, their annual cultural festival.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sunburn at NITT|url=http://sunburn.in/events#sunburn-campus-with-candice-redding-trichy/3289|website=Sunburn}}</ref> IIIT-Bhubaneswar also successfully hosted Sunburn in [[Advaita (festival)|ADVAITA 2014]], Annual Cultural festival if [[International Institute of Information Technology, Bhubaneswar|IIIT Bhubaneswar]]. IIM Kashipur also hosted Sunburn in January 2015 as a part of their Cultural Fest Agnitraya 2015, other premier Institute like [[Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra]] also hosted Sunburn in March 2015 as a part of their Annual Fest Bitotsav. IIT Indore hosted sunburn in Fluxus 2016 .
[[Jaypee University of Engineering and Technology|Jaypee University of Engineering & Technology]] ,Guna (MP) hosted Sunburn in [[D'Equinox]] 2016 include '''Sunburn festival''' with Ankur Sood ,Progressive Brothers and Candice Redding.
===Sunburn Goa 2014=== The 8th edition took place in Vagator on 27th, 28, 29th and 30th Dec 2014 and for the first time the festival was extended for an extra day and was performed by World no 2 Dj then [[Dimitri Vegas & Like Mike]] and witnessed around 150 DJ's. Known artists includes [[Knife Party]], [[Sander van Doorn]], Sasha, [[Krewella]], [[Baauer]], Danny Avila, Head Hunterz, Deniz Koyu, Dubvision, [[Paul Oakenfold]], [[Matthew Koma]], MAKJ, Michael and Tarzan Woods performed at the festival.
===Sunburn Goa 2015=== The 9th edition is another 4 day event at Vagator, Goa. On November 20, 2015 Sunburn Goa's international ticketing partner, [[Viagogo]], announced that the festival has become one of the largest international music festivals in Asia,<ref>http://popdust.com/2015/11/20/sunburn-goa-become-largest-international-music-festival-asia/</ref> with people from more than 42 countries buying tickets on the viagogo platform. On November 24, 2015, the management of Sunburn Goa also released a statement citing this fact and proving to fans in India that they did not need to travel half way around the world to get the same experience as Festival Tomorrowland. Sunburn Goa 2015 is expected to draw the largest crowds since its inception.<ref>http://www.sify.com/news/sunburn-goa-announces-the-biggest-line-up-ever-with-4-massive-headliners-news-default-plytXEadgdbeg.html</ref> This year's artist lineup will be equally lavish with over 120 artists like [[Show Me Love (Robin S. song)|Sam Feldt]], [[KYGO]], [[Seth Troxler]], [[Dimitri Vegas & Like Mike]], [[Martin Garrix]], [[KSHMR|Kshmr]], [[David Guetta]], [[Dyro]], [[Felix Jaehn]], Zaeden and [[Art Department (DJ duo)|Art Department]] taking the stage.

[[File:Steghose gold1.JPG|thumb|Stirrup pants designed as sportswear.]] '''Stirrup pants''' (or stirrup leggings) are a of type close-fitting ladies' pant that tapers at the ankle, similar to leggings, except that the material extends to a band, or strap, that is worn under the arch of the foot to hold the pant leg in place. The band of material is often elasticized to prevent the material around the foot from tearing. Stirrup pants were originally sportswear for women, and remain sportswear for horse riding and skiing. However, they have come in and out of fashion during the 20th and early 21st centuries, peaking in popularity as street fashion during the 1980s.
==History== Stirrup pants were first worn as breeches for horse riders. The purpose of the strap under the foot was to hold the pant legs in place in the boots of the rider. As ladies moved away from riding sidesaddle, they began wearing riding breeches in the 1920s in a similar style to those worn by men. By 1934, [[Jodhpurs]] as riding pants with foot straps were being advertised in the United States mail order catalogue for [[Sears]].<ref>{{cite book|last=Blum|first=Stella|title=Everyday Fashions of the Thirties As Pictured in Sears Catalogs|year=1986|publisher=Dover Publications|isbn=978-0-486-25108-0|pages=62}}</ref> Horse riding breeches are still made with an elastic foot strap in some designs. Stirrup pants for skiing were introduced at the [[1936 Winter Olympic Games]] in Germany.<ref>{{cite book|last=Hewitt, Valerie; Ann Kellogg; and Lynn Payne|title=The Greenwood Encyclopedia of Clothing Through American History, 1900 to the Present: Volume 1, 1900-1949|year=2008|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|isbn=978-0-313-33395-8|pages=218}}</ref>
Stirrup stretch pants were a mainstay of ski wear for both men and women during most of the 1960s and part of the 1970s. In the 1960s this style was used for women's and girls' stirrup pants. They were popular for several years as shown in clothing catalogs of the day, such as J.C. Penny, Sears, and Montgomery Ward.
Stirrup pants became a popular casual fashion for women in Europe and America from the mid-1980s to the early 1990s. In 1985, Linda Pender wrote in ''Cincinnati Magazine'' that stirrup pants were "being touted as ''the'' wardrobe basic of the year, and ''every''body is buying them". On the one hand, the style was promoted as being "easy to wear" and giving "most figures a long, lean line"; on the other hand, a salesclerk pointed out to Pender that the style was not flattering unless the wearer was "slim and fit".<ref>{{Cite news|last=Pender|first=Linda|title=Cruel Pants: The unkindest cut of all|newspaper=Cincinnati Magazine|date=October 1985|page=22}}</ref> Leggings in general became fashionable streetwear during the 1980s, as did sweatshirts, leg warmers, and other items that originated in sports and dance studios.<ref>{{cite book|last=Condra, Jill. Ed.|title=The Greenwood Encyclopedia of Clothing Through World History: Volume 3, 1801 to the Present|year=2007|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|isbn=978-0-313-33665-2|pages=202}}</ref>
From about 2010 on, stirrup pants, stretch or not, have become just another style of pants for use by women and men for sports, running or general wear.

'''Yoga pants''' are a type of flexible, form-fitting pants designed for the practice of [[yoga]] as well as other physical activities that involve a lot of movement, bending and stretching. They are typically worn for sports and physical exercise, [[martial arts]], [[dancing]], [[pilates]], or [[aerobics]]. These pants are generally made of cotton, lycra spandex, nylon, polyester, wool, or a similarly light and [[stretch fabric|stretchy synthetic material]] giving the pants a very smooth and silk-like finish when worn.<ref name=Smith>{{cite web|last=Smith|first=S.E.|title=What are Yoga Pants?|url=http://www.wisegeek.com/what-are-yoga-pants.htm|work=WG|publisher=[[wiseGEEK]]|accessdate=5 December 2011}}</ref> They are usually black, tight-fitted, and have an elastic waistband folded over at the top. Although designed specifically for yoga, the pants are also worn casually by many women.<ref name=Smith/><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/xx_factor/2014/01/03/_workout_wear_friday_and_yoga_pants_that_look_like_dress_pants_no.html | title=Workout Wear Friday Is Not a Thing | publisher=Slate | date=Jan 3, 2014 | accessdate=30 January 2014 | author=Jessica Grose}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://pilates.about.com/od/pilatesclothing/p/Find-The-Best-Pilates-And-Yoga-Pants-For-You.htm | title=Find the Best Pilates and Yoga Pants for You | publisher=About.com | date=October 8, 2013 | accessdate=30 January 2014 | author=Marguerite Ogle}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2513436/Are-yoga-pants-new-jeans-How-trend-led-workout-clothes-making-fashion-statements-outside-gym.html | title=Are yoga pants the new jeans? How trend-led workout clothes are making fashion statements outside the gym | publisher=Daily Mail | date=25 November 2013 | accessdate=30 January 2014}}</ref><ref name=NYT>{{cite web|last=Brodesser-Akner|first=Taffy|title=To Stretch or Not to Stretch|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/03/17/fashion/17elastic.html?pagewanted=all|work=Fashion and Style|publisher=[[New York Times]]|accessdate=5 December 2011|date=16 March 2011}}</ref>
